description: My position is the full stack web developer and my responsibility is to develop Angular frontend and NodeJS backend softwares for embedded kiosks device used in universities, hospitals, and public buildings.

I have developed a secure and reliable identity server based on IdentityServer4 and Skoruba Identity Server Admin. Moreover, I am working on enhancing the business logic of APIs and decreasing the number of API calls from the Angular front-end (minimizing load time). This project is going to publish and after that I will continue my cooperation as a backup developer for the maintenance service.

Developing the industrial platform in order to monitor and control the power grid network and SCADA systems. This project called FaraWAMS, is a successor project after Simpal v2. We are designing the high-performance and real-time platform to manage big data processing. To increase the performance of our databases, we used Apache Ignite in-memory database for managing real-time data, Microsoft SQL Server as the main relational database, and MongoDB to store archive data. The .Net 6 is used for its back-end and ReactJS is used for its front-end.

I was a graduated researcher at Iran University of Science and Technology in collaboration with the Universit√© Grenoble Alpes in France. As a result of my research, I published many scientific papers.

Provides a platform for promoting sympathy and social connectivity in hard times and aims to cherish valuable norms and humanistic traits among people. Candle connects generations and expands sympathy. I worked as a back-end developer and developed ExpressJS and Swagger parts of this project.

The main goal of these projects is to design and develop .Net based multi-level software for monitoring the electrical and distribution substations called Simpal v1 and v2. I worked with the software team and we develops the user interface for Simpal v1 and I were in charge of designing back-end and front-end of Simpal v2 as a senior software developer. We designed user-friendly modules to illustrate real-time charts so that researchers can monitor the archives' power grid system data and plan design of new power stations.
I developed many projects during this time, such as FNN, Noonnet, Restaurant Management System, and Neuro20EP for many people and companies.

Participating in the project of designing a graphical interface for an ultrasonic homogenizer device, designing a 3D printer software interface, and website development are among my activities in this company.
